intro: Pselium ambiguum, commonly known as the hairy pellitory, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Pselium ambiguum is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
